text: People from Shanghai are always calculating and obsessed with money.
Residents of Chengdu are naturally laid-back and spend all their time drinking tea and playing mahjong.
Everyone in Shenzhen is a workaholic tech entrepreneur with no personal life.
Beijing locals are all arrogant and look down on people from other provinces.
The people of Guangzhou will eat absolutely anything with four legs except a table.
Life in Xi'an is entirely centered around its ancient history, with no modern culture.
Harbin residents are completely accustomed to and unfazed by extreme cold.
Wuhan people have fiery tempers and are prone to shouting in daily conversation.
Everyone in Suzhou is gentle, soft-spoken, and engaged in classical arts.
Chongqing is nothing but steep hills, hotpot, and a maze of overpasses.
Shanghai is a major financial center and port city on China's east coast.
Chengdu is the capital of Sichuan province and serves as a key hub for southwestern China.
Shenzhen is a special economic zone in Guangdong province, known for its rapid modern development.
Beijing is the national capital and hosts many historical sites and government institutions.
Guangzhou is a major commercial city and the provincial capital of Guangdong.
Xi'an is a city in Shaanxi province with significant historical landmarks from several dynasties.
Harbin is the capital of Heilongjiang province and experiences cold winters.
Wuhan is the capital of Hubei province, situated at the confluence of the Yangtze and Han rivers.
Suzhou, in Jiangsu province, is known for its classical gardens and canal systems.
Chongqing is a large municipality in southwestern China with a distinctive mountainous terrain.
